area_name: Point, Powderhorn, Colorado (AKA Indian Creek), The

content.description: Climb the bolt line that moves left up the slab to the anchors.
content.location: This route is about 200 feet west down the trail from the overhung wall.  It is the 1st bolted climb after the broken slabs.

content.description: This climb is very sustained, hard, 5.9 climbing, that may be difficult for 5.9 climbers to on-sight....
content.location: It is the left route on the spire 20-30 feet left of the overhung wall.

content.description:
The crux is at the fourth bolt - Â it is an exposed, balancy clip.

You could bring some gear to protect the runouts.
content.protection: Two bolted anchors with chains. The chains are painted to mimic the wall color.
content.location:
This is bolted line to the right of

Fear of Flying

. As of Spring 2021, it is the farthest route to the right on this wall.

content.description: The crux is right off the deck until you pull over the roof to the slab.  There is potential for deck falls on the 1st 2 bolts (like many climbs...), maybe that's where the name came from???
content.protection:
Bolts and a 2-bolt anchor (shared with

Frequent Flyer Miles

& and

Pleasure Spiked with Pain

).
content.location: This climb goes over the roof and up the slab to the arete just left of the overhung wall.

content.description: This is a great overhung climb with some powerful sidepull moves at the end of the overhung section. It eases up a bit once it slabs out.
content.protection:
8-bolts and a 2-bolt anchor (shared with

Frequent Flier Miles

&

Point of Danger

).
content.location: It is the 3rd bolted route from the right on the overhung wall, just left of the seam.

content.description: Pirate in Paradise is an overhung climb that starts on big jugs that get smaller and smaller as you go. The crux is clipping the anchors, but there's also a technical section by the last bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor (no chains, but the bolts are unusually large which will accommodate rappelling). Or you can leave an anchor and clean it from any other climbs on this wall....
content.location: It is the 2nd bolted route from the right on the overhung wall.

content.description: This climb starts up the finger crack the moves left to the face and eventually up to a technical slab at the top.
content.location: This climb starts in the crack just left and around the corner from the overhung wall.

content.description:
Mud Shark is a nice and straightforward warm-up climb. Follow 3 bolts up a vertical face on positive crimps and jugs.

There are 2 other bolted climbs to the right of Mud Shark. They both merge into the end of this climb and share the anchor.
content.location:
This small buttress is a separate feature from the main Powderhorn cliffband.

When approaching from the road, it will be the first feature you encounter. From the main path, take the right fork, the left will take you to the old mine site and the main climbing area. Mud Shark is the line directly right of a black water streak.

content.description: This climb follows the bolted line up the slab.
content.location: This is the 2nd line up the slab about 200 feet west down the trail from the overhung wall.

content.description: This climb follows the bolt line just right of the arete.  The crux is right off the deck to the 1st bolt.
content.location: It is the 3rd bolted line from the base.

content.description:
This a great sustained overhung climb! Going left to the arete eases difficulty a bit.

Some of the bolts are a bit awkward to clip, but if draws are pre-hung by your partner, it's not bad.
content.protection:
8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor (shared with

Pleasure Spiked with Pain

&

Point of Danger

).
content.location: It is the far left route on the overhung wall (the 4th bolted line from the right).

content.description: The crux is 2/3 way up. There are some small crimps.
content.location: This is the bolted line just left of the offwidth crack.

content.description: Diagonal Danzin' is a straightforward climb. Climbing left of the bolt line yields easier climbing.
This is a fun climb that starts out overhung on jugs. The crux is between the 2nd and 3rd bolts. Once you mantel onto the to 2 jugs above the 3rd bolt, the climb eases up a lot.
Climb up the big, bulging, sloper holds to an easier finish after the last bolt.
content.location: This is the bolted route on the right side of the spire about 20-30 feet left of the overhung wall.

content.description: This climb is accurately named, because you need some big kahunas to pull the slopey overhung runout crux between the 3rd and 4th bolt.... There is probably no move harder than a 5.9, but it is much scarier than most....
content.location: This is the last climb in this crag. Follow the trail about 200 feet west of the overhung wall, it is the bolted line up over a few bulges just left (west) of the two slab climbs.

content.description: I have not climbed this climb.... I'm not sure of the rating, I'm just posting it so you will not be confused when finding the other climbs....

pathTokens: Point, Powderhorn, Colorado (AKA Indian Creek), The
